title: W3C Web Platform Incubator Community Group-relevant MDN issues
description: Issue filed on MDN Web Docs related to pages attached to technologies developed by W3C Web Platform Incubator Community Group

items.content_html:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystemHandle

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

Query/Request Permissions

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

In the example, the first line is set to const opts = {}. Given that opts is modified at a later stage (opts.mode = "readwrite";), we need to use let instead of const.

What did you expect to see?

async function verifyPermission(fileHandle, withWrite) {
  let opts = {};
  if (withWrite) {
    opts.mode = "readwrite";
  }
...
}

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

N/A

Do you have anything more you want to share?

N/A

items.title: [file-system-access] Fix example in FileSystemHandle

items.content_html:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HIDConnectionEvent

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

(the first part), Constructor

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

This article says that this event (HIDConnectionEvent) is create and passed when an input report is received.

However, this event is for connection and disconnection of devices and doesn't look related to input reports (handled with HIDInputReportEvent).

If the "input report" in this article is something different from "input report" haneled with HIDInputReportEvent, it looks confusing to use the same phrase.

What did you expect to see?

Clearer wording without using "input report", if it stands for different thing than "input report" handled with HIDInputReportEvent.
For example, "events are created when devices are connected or disconnected" for the Constructor part.

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

No response

Do you have anything more you want to share?

The constructor page
HIDConnectionEvent() - Web APIs | MDN
also uses the phrase "input report" in similar ways in the first part and the Parameters section.
These should also be replaced if they in the main article are replaced.

MDN metadata

Page report details

  • Last commit: 066257c
  • Document last modified: 2022-10-10T08:28:51.000Z
items.title: [webhid] Confusing phrase "input report" is used for HIDConnectionEvent

items.content_html:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystemHandle

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

FileSystemDirectoryHandle

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

The File System Access API doesn't address the question of how to manage package bundles (e.g. .textbundle files) or compressed archives (e.g. .zip files).

The above types of files have a kind of 'file' when they should really be identified as having a kind of 'Directory'.

You cannot use window.showDirectoryPicker() to select a package bundle or zip archive.

The window.showOpenFilePicker() allows us to select the above types of files, but won't allow us to work with their contents.

What did you expect to see?

Package bundles or compressed archives should really be identified as having a kind of 'Directory' and be accessible using the window.showDirectoryPicker() method.

We should be able to identify and iterate through the contents of such packages.

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

https://playcode.io/1000385

Do you have anything more you want to share?

No response

items.title: [file-system-access] File System Access API is incomplete

items.content_html:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FileSystemHandle/requestPermission

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

Exceptions

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

Only TypeError is listed, but it's possible for requestPermission() to reject with a SecurityError

What did you expect to see?

Mentioning that a SecurityError can be thrown and when.

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

Here is a demonstration of a situation where you might get a SecurityError. Click 'pick' to select a file or folder on disk, then click 'request write permission' and wait 6 seconds for the SecurityError to occur.
Source code for this is available here.

Also, here is SecurityError mentioned in the spec.

Do you have anything more you want to share?

No response

items.title: [file-system-access] `FileSystemHandle.requestPermission()` can throw `SecurityError`

What did you expect to see?

items.content_html:
MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SyncManager/register

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

A lot of the information on the page appears to be incorrect. I see substantial discrepancies between the description of register() in the WICG spec and the MDN docs.

Specific section or headline?

There are discrepancies in all of the sections:

  • description
  • syntax
  • returns
  • parameters

What did you expect to see?

  • The description says that the method returns Promise<SyncRegistration>, but the spec says it's Promise<undefined>.
  • The syntax section shows that [options] are passed in as a parameter, but the spec says it's a single string used as the tag. The syntax also shows .then(function(syncRegistration) { ... }), but as previously stated, it's Promise<undefined>.
  • The returns section should be Promise<undefined>, not Promise<SyncRegistration>.
  • The parameters are incorrect. They don't mention the tag string value at all, and have a bunch of options that are... I'm not really sure where they come from, but I don't see them mentioned in the specification at all.

Did you test this? If so, how?

I am just comparing the MDN docs to the specification. I have used register('tagname') before, though, and I know that the parameter is supposed to be a string.

MDN Content page report details
  • Folder: en-us/web/api/syncmanager/register
  • MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/SyncManager/register
  • GitHub URL: https://github.com/mdn/content/blob/main/files/en-us/web/api/syncmanager/register/index.html
  • Last commit: 7eaf51c
  • Document last modified: 2021-07-26T09:31:13.000Z
items.title: [background-sync] Issue with "SyncManager.register()": incorrect params and return

items.content_html:
mdn/browser-compat-data#9125 is a long discussion about the peculiar cases of Location+WorkerLocation and Navigator+WorkerNavigator, which are the only APIs on the web platform where distinct interfaces are used to represent the "same" thing in window and worker contexts.

For example, navigator.userAgent is available in both window and worker contexts, but navigator itself is a different kind of object. (This difference rarely matters in practice.)

BCD will follow the structure of specs/implementations, but on MDN there's duplication that might be possible to avoid. These pairs of pages and their subpages should be considered for merging or cross-linking:

  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator + https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WorkerNavigator
  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Location + https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WorkerLocation

For location it's probably best to keep them separate since the worker variant is read-only. But navigator it's hard to see the usefulness of splits like this:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/languages
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WorkerNavigator/languages
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Navigator/locks
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WorkerNavigator/locks
items.title: [html, web-locks] Avoiding duplication/confusion between Location+WorkerLocation and Navigator+WorkerNavigator

});
